title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules, which may be cited as the Rules of the Superior Courts 
(Orders 105 and 106) 2020, shall come into operation on the 7th day of August
text_norm: 1 (1) rule may cited rule superior court (orders 105 106) 2020 shall come operation 7th day august

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: (2) These Rules shall be construed together with the Rules of the Superior
text_raw:
2020. 

(2) These Rules shall be construed together with the Rules of the Superior 

Courts. 

(3) The Rules of the Superior Courts as amended by these Rules may be cited 

as the Rules of the Superior Courts 1986 to 2020.
text_norm: 2020 (2) rule shall construed together rule superior court (3) rule superior court amended rule may cited rule superior court 1986 2020

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. Any application to the High Court arising from a dispute referred to the
text_raw:
2. Any application to the High Court arising from a dispute referred to the 
Employment Appeals Tribunal prior to the entry into force of these Rules may 
be commenced, continued and determined before the High Court as if these 
Rules had not entered into force.
text_norm: 2 application high court arising dispute referred employment appeal tribunal prior entry force rule may commenced continued determined high court rule entered force

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 3. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended by the substitution for
text_raw:
3. The Rules of the Superior Courts are amended by the substitution for 

Orders 105 and 106 of the respective Orders set out in the Schedule. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [257] 

Schedule 

“Order 105 

Appeals and references from the Labour Court

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 1. In this Order:
text_norm: 1 order act 1967 mean redundancy payment act 1967 act 1977 mean unfair dismissal act 1977 act 2015 mean workplace relation act 2015

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. Every appeal to the Court under:
text_raw:
2. Every appeal to the Court under: 

(i) 

section 40 of the Act of 1967, or 

(ii) 

section 10A of the Act of 1977, or 

(iii) section 46 of the Act of 2015, 

shall be brought by originating notice of motion.
text_norm: 2 every appeal court (i) section 40 act 1967 (ii) section 10a act 1977 (iii) section 46 act 2015 shall brought originating notice motion

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 3. The originating notice of motion shall be entitled in the matter of the
text_raw:
3. The originating notice of motion shall be entitled in the matter of the 
relevant Act, on the application of the person bringing the appeal, and shall state 
the decision of the Labour Court appealed against and the grounds of appeal.
text_norm: 3 originating notice motion shall entitled matter relevant act application person bringing appeal shall state decision labour court appealed ground appeal

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 4. The originating notice of motion shall be served on the Minister for
text_raw:
4. The originating notice of motion shall be served on the Minister for 
Business, Enterprise and Innovation and on all parties to the decision of the Labour 
Court.
text_norm: 4 originating notice motion shall served minister business enterprise innovation party decision labour court

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 5. The originating notice of motion shall be issued within the time limit
text_raw:
5. The originating notice of motion shall be issued within the time limit 

specified for appeals to the Court from the Labour Court in (as the case may be): 

(i) 

section 40 of the Act of 1967, or 

(ii) 

section 10A of the Act of 1977, or 

(iii) section 46 of the Act of 2015.
text_norm: 5 originating notice motion shall issued within time limit specified appeal court labour court (as case may be) (i) section 40 act 1967 (ii) section 10a act 1977 (iii) section 46 act 2015

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 6. Any question referred to the Court by the Labour Court under section 44(6)
text_raw:
6. Any question referred to the Court by the Labour Court under section 44(6) 
of the Act of 2015 shall be brought by originating notice of motion, entitled in the 
matter of the Workplace Relations Act 2015, on the application of the Labour 
Court. The originating notice of motion shall state concisely the question referred 
for the decision of the Court and shall be served on all parties to the application to 
the Labour Court.
text_norm: 6 question referred court labour court section 44(6) act 2015 shall brought originating notice motion entitled matter workplace relation act 2015 application labour court originating notice motion shall state concisely question referred decision court shall served party application labour court

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 7. No costs shall be allowed of any proceedings under this Order unless the
text_raw:
7. No costs shall be allowed of any proceedings under this Order unless the 

Court shall by special order allow such costs.” 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [257] 5 

“Order 106 

Proceedings under the Employment Equality Acts 1998 and 2004 and the 
Workplace Relations Act 2015
text_norm: 7 cost shall allowed proceeding order unless court shall special order allow cost 257 5 order 106 proceeding employment equality act 1998 2004 workplace relation act 2015

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: In this Order:
text_norm: 1 order act mean employment equality act 1998 act 2004 mean equality act 2004 act 2015 mean workplace relation act 2015 director mean director general workplace relation commission

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 2. Any appeal to the High Court on a point of law from a determination on
text_raw:
2. Any appeal to the High Court on a point of law from a determination on 
appeal of the Labour Court under section 90(1) of the Act (as substituted by 
section 46 of, and the Schedule to, the Act of 2004) shall be brought by 
originating notice of motion.
text_norm: 2 appeal high court point law determination appeal labour court section 90(1) act (as substituted section 46 schedule act 2004) shall brought originating notice motion

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 3. The originating notice of motion referred to in rule 2 shall be entitled in
text_raw:
3. The originating notice of motion referred to in rule 2 shall be entitled in 
the matter of the Act, on the application of the appellant and shall state the 
determination of the Labour Court appealed against and the grounds of appeal.
text_norm: 3 originating notice motion referred rule 2 shall entitled matter act application appellant shall state determination labour court appealed ground appeal

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: In all cases the originating notice of motion referred to in rule 2 shall be
text_raw:
4. 

In all cases the originating notice of motion referred to in rule 2 shall be 
served on all parties to the determination of the Labour Court and on the Minister 
for Business, Enterprise and Innovation.
text_norm: 4 case originating notice motion referred rule 2 shall served party determination labour court minister business enterprise innovation

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 5. The originating notice of motion referred to in rule 2 shall be issued
text_raw:
5. The originating notice of motion referred to in rule 2 shall be issued 
within 42 days of the date on which the determination of the Labour Court was 
given.
text_norm: 5 originating notice motion referred rule 2 shall issued within 42 day date determination labour court given

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 6. Any question referred to the High Court by the Labour Court pursuant to
text_raw:
6. Any question referred to the High Court by the Labour Court pursuant to 
section 90(2) of the Act (as substituted by section 46 of, and the Schedule to, the 
Act of 2004) shall be brought by originating notice of motion, entitled in the 
matter of the Act, on the application of the Labour Court. The originating notice 
of motion shall state concisely the question referred for the decision of the High 
Court and shall be served on all parties to the appeal before the Labour Court.
text_norm: 6 question referred high court labour court pursuant section 90(2) act (as substituted section 46 schedule act 2004) shall brought originating notice motion entitled matter act application labour court originating notice motion shall state concisely question referred decision high court shall served party appeal labour court

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 7. (1) An application to the High Court by the Irish Human Rights and
text_raw:
7. (1) An application to the High Court by the Irish Human Rights and 
Equality Commission for an order pursuant to section 10(5) or section 85(5) of 
the Act shall be brought by originating notice of motion. The notice of motion 
shall state the reliefs sought and shall specify the advertisement, discrimination 
or conduct complained of or the compliance required, as the case may be. 

(2) In any case the Court, if satisfied that the delay caused by proceeding by 
motion on notice under this rule would or might entail irreparable or serious 
mischief, may make any order ex parte upon such terms as to costs or otherwise 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [257] 

and subject to such undertaking, if any, as the Court may think just; and any 
party affected by such order may move to set it aside.
text_norm: 7 (1) application high court irish human right equality commission order pursuant section 10(5) section 85(5) act shall brought originating notice motion notice motion shall state relief sought shall specify advertisement discrimination conduct complained compliance required case may be (2) case court satisfied delay caused proceeding motion notice rule would might entail irreparable serious mischief may make order ex parte upon term cost otherwise 6 257 subject undertaking court may think party affected order may move set aside

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 8. Notice of the application referred to in rule 7 shall be given to the person
text_raw:
8. Notice of the application referred to in rule 7 shall be given to the person 
against whom relief is sought. If it shall appear to the Court that any person to 
whom notice has not been given ought to have received such notice, the Court 
may either dismiss the application or adjourn the hearing thereof in order that 
such notice may be given upon such terms (if any) as the Court may think fit to 
impose.
text_norm: 8 notice application referred rule 7 shall given person relief sought shall appear court person notice given ought received notice court may either dismiss application adjourn hearing thereof order notice may given upon term (if any) court may think fit impose

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 9. Pending the hearing of the application referred to in rule 7, the Court
text_raw:
9. Pending the hearing of the application referred to in rule 7, the Court 
may, if it appears just and proper to do so, make such interim or interlocutory 
order restraining the publication of the advertisement complained of or 
restraining the conduct or discrimination complained of or requiring the 
compliance sought, as the case may be.
text_norm: 9 pending hearing application referred rule 7 court may appears proper make interim interlocutory order restraining publication advertisement complained restraining conduct discrimination complained requiring compliance sought case may be

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 10. An application to the High Court for an order under section 97(2)(b) of
text_raw:
10. An application to the High Court for an order under section 97(2)(b) of 
the Act authorising the publication or disclosure of information furnished to, or 
otherwise acquired by, the Labour Court, the Director or any other person, by 
virtue of sections 94 to 96 of the Act, or otherwise in the course, or for the 
purposes, of any investigation, mediation or hearing under Part VII of the Act 
shall be brought by originating notice of motion, entitled in the matter of the Act, 
on the application of the applicant. The notice of motion shall be grounded on 
an affidavit sworn by or on behalf of the applicant, which shall identify the nature 
or presumed nature and source of the information in question, the circumstances 
in which the information in question was furnished, the publication or disclosure 
sought, and the interest of the applicant in such publication or disclosure. The 
notice of motion and a copy of the grounding affidavit shall be served on the 
Labour Court, the Director or the other person to whom the information has been 
furnished, on the person who furnished the information and on any person to 
whom it is believed the information relates.
text_norm: 10 application high court order section 97(2)(b) act authorising publication disclosure information furnished otherwise acquired labour court director person virtue section 94 96 act otherwise course purpose investigation mediation hearing part vii act shall brought originating notice motion entitled matter act application applicant notice motion shall grounded affidavit sworn behalf applicant shall identify nature presumed nature source information question circumstance information question furnished publication disclosure sought interest applicant publication disclosure notice motion copy grounding affidavit shall served labour court director person information furnished person furnished information person believed information relates

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 11. An appeal to the Court under section 98(7)(a) of the Act shall be
text_raw:
11. An appeal to the Court under section 98(7)(a) of the Act shall be 
commenced and conducted by originating notice of motion in accordance with 
Order 84C.
text_norm: 11 appeal court section 98(7)(a) act shall commenced conducted originating notice motion accordance order 84c

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: 12. (1) Subject to sub-rule (2) of rule 7, the originating notice of motion and
text_raw:
12. (1) Subject to sub-rule (2) of rule 7, the originating notice of motion and 
a copy of the grounding affidavit and of any exhibits thereto in any application 
or appeal under this Order shall be served upon each respondent not later than 
21 days before the date fixed for the hearing of the motion. 

(2) A copy of any affidavit in opposition to an application or appeal made 
under this Order shall be filed by the respondent within 14 days of the service 
on the respondent of the applicant’s affidavit and the respondent must within 
such period serve a copy of such affidavit on the applicant. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 (3) Save where the Court otherwise directs, the hearing of an appeal or 

application under this Order shall be by way of affidavit.” 

[257] 7 

 
 
 
 8 [257]
text_norm: 12 (1) subject sub-rule (2) rule 7 originating notice motion copy grounding affidavit exhibit thereto application appeal order shall served upon respondent later 21 day date fixed hearing motion (2) copy affidavit opposition application appeal made order shall filed respondent within 14 day service respondent applicant affidavit respondent must within period serve copy affidavit applicant (3) save court otherwise directs hearing appeal application order shall way affidavit 257 7 8 257

title: provisions of the Courts of Justice Act 1953, section 15, by virtue of the powers
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The amendments take account of repeals of statutory provisions and of new 
provisions under, or inserted by, the Workplace Relations Act 2015. Proceedings 
previously commenced by special summons will now commence by originating 
notice of motion. Further, in Order 106, rule 5, the time limit for the bringing of 
an appeal on a point of law to the High Court from a determination on appeal of 
the Labour Court under Section 90(1) of the Employment Equality Act 1998 (as 
substituted by Section 46 of, and the Schedule to, the Act of 2004) is increased 
to 42 days from 21 days, to align same with the statutory time limits for appeals 
provided for in the 2015 Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [257] 9
